greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If p^b(p,n) is the highest power of the prime p dividing n, then a(n) = sum_{p|n} b(p,n)^b(p,n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = 1 iff n is prime, a(n) = 2 iff n is a nonsquare semiprime (A006881). - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 27 2005
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{fi = Last@Transpose@FactorInteger@n}, Plus @@ (fi^fi)]; Rest@Array[f, 92] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_ *)
program: (PARI) A112621(n) = { my(f = factor(n), s = 0); for (k=1, #f~, s += (f[k, 2]^f[k, 2]); ); s; } \\ _Antti Karttunen_, May 28 2017
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Dec 25 2005
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 27 2005
Term a(1) = 0 prepended, data section extended to 105 terms - _Antti Karttunen_, May 28 2017
